answers.answer: I had severe insulin resistance and pre diabetes with normal fasting glucose levels. An oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT) which showed up the pre diabetes and my insulin serum showed high levels.

Well ima see the doctor in 2 days, is there anything u think I should do that can help me with all this. I mean I saw that low blood pressure and high blood pressure cause the same symptoms and since I have been stressing a lot with my anxiety I feel like that's what's happening but ima explain to the doctor everything that's happening. And plus I'm low on vitamin d and on this one website I saw people get a lot of pains throughout there body especially there hands and feet. They even get depressed , there legs swell up, they also get headaches or fuzzy like feeling like if they were high which I've had and sore muscles too. Idk if it's like a mixture of things plus I saw ear infections can be cause lightheadedness after eating and lately my ears and tonsils can get really itchy idk. Like I don't want to think it's prediabetisis but idk. People that are hyper. Usually get high blood pressure and fast heart rate which is what I have, it just gets worse when I eat and sleep. And I saw that it can also makes u eat more often, you lose weight which I have, and pee and pooped frequently which I do. My legs do get  swollen and hard at times and my right hand starts tingling a lot feels like I'm getting arthritis, hand gets really hard to bend And middle finger hurts at times especially where my finger bends.
My good cholesterol did show up a little low it's at 36
Actually my glucose level was at 81
Honestly they just told me tsh level was low 0.58 but I have no idea. I've also been stressing a lot so I don't know if it's making my symptoms worse

My thyroid symptoms worsens when I'm stressed. That TSH is on the low end (hyperthyroid end) of the range.  I had a look online and found this comment..."I had the same symptoms as you, pounding heart rate, especially laying down, or after eating certain foods. Always very tired, moody, grumpy, acing muscles and joints, blurry vision, (especially when tired)After trying to figure out what was wrong me our alternative doctor ordered blood work and sure enough I have hyperthyroidism."

When thyroid hormones are off, your entire body is affected.  EVERY cell in your body needs thyroid hormone for proper metabolism.  So, when we are either hypo or hyper, we often feel like we have a million different things wrong with us.As we discussed in a previous thread, you need further testing to determine exactly what you have and to get treatment for it.  Stressing over every symptom is only going to make you feel worse.

question: So I feel like my thyroid problem symtoms relate more to diabetic symtoms but I got my glucose checked almost 3 months ago and it came out normal 88 after 10 hours of fasting. But I get light headed after eating my heart starts beating really fast I get like sleepy and a little shakey. My heart doesn't stop beating fast for hours idk it's weird. I have been stressing a lot. Plus my hands and feet get tingly at times too my legs hurt and my arms and my hips and ribs plus my lower back. Idk all of this is weird. I am over weight as well. But when I had a physical everything came out good except for my thyroid levels and my vitamin d levels. I'm not anemic with because I thought that's what been causing everything but idk has anyone experienced this. My blood pressure also has been going up and down. And I'm always hungry and I've been peeing a lot often and today I got cotton mouth, idk there related to diabetic symtoms and everything I eat is messing with me someone help :/
title: Sorry another question
